content.rendered:
THE GIFT OF GIVING

OUR FAVORITE WEDDING FAVOR IDEAS

In the spirit of gift-giving season, there's nothing better than going the extra mile to thank your guests. And what better way to show your appreciation than by giving them a thoughtful gift to take home to commemorate your special day?

From custom koozies and guitar picks to sweet treats and sick beats, we love all the creative ways in which our couples have thanked their guests for celebrating with them. It's truly the icing on the cake!

Keep scrolling to see some sweet endings from real new beginnings.

1. A warm wedding welcome.

Allison and Jack welcomed their guests to Music City with sweet care packages waiting in their hotel rooms.

Weekend essentials included custom water bottles, snacks, Advil, personalized koozies, the wedding itinerary and even a custom do-not-disturb sign by Nico & Lala!

Photography: Erin McCall

2. An ode to Music City.

Lauren and Wade's guests took an iconic piece of Nashville home to their respective cities, a Loveless Cafe guitar pick!

Photography: 30MilesWest

Leslie and Kyle gave their guests a taste of Tennessee with miniature bottles of Music City Sauce. Even more thoughtful? Leslie and Kyle are friends with the creators of the local hot sauce, and we can't think of a better way to share Nashville with their guests.

Photography: SheHeWe

And an Infinity favorite? Goo Goo Clusters! This candy bar has been a Nashville staple since 1912. And dare we say it? You just can't leave Tennessee without one.

Photography: Chesley Summar Photography

3. A wedding day keepsake.

With Christmas being her favorite holiday, Melissa and Sutton embraced the season by giving their guests custom ornaments calligraphed by K.Kelley Designs.

4. Take one home and let love grow.

Kendra and Logan gave out evergreen seedlings to friends and family at their winter wedding. It was a sweet reminder of their growing, unending love.

Photography: Love Is A Big Deal

5. Recover and recharge.

Dani and Jim thought ahead and had hangover kits waiting for their guests to aid in WWR, aka Wedding Reception Recovery.

Photography: Joe Hendricks

6. Please don't stop the music!

Music lovers, Sloan and Drew gave each of their guests a "mixtape" made up of songs from their wedding day. Complete with a custom CD sleeve, guests are still complimenting their wedding takeaway nearly four years later!

7. A storybook ending.

Amanda and William decided on a literary theme and had place cards made out of their favorite book pages. To cap off the evening, guests each took home one of the couple's favorite books.

excerpt.rendered: Our favorite wedding favor ideas from real weddings at The Bell Tower & The Bridge Building.
